thread.title: Downtown Disney name change kicks in Tuesday
thread.title_full: Downtown Disney name change kicks in Tuesday

author: Dewayne Bevil
title: Downtown Disney name change kicks in Tuesday
text:
A ceremony will mark the occasion on Tuesday prior to festivities related to the opening of Morimoto Asia, one of the restaurants added to the longtime entertainment complex as part of an extensive years-long retheming. 
Disney Springs will be styled as an early 20th century Florida town. 
The name change has been gradually implemented. It was recently evident on Interstate 4 signs indicating the exits for Disney Springs. Caption Jock Lindsey's Hangar Bar Matt Mauney /Orlando Sentinel 
Jock Lindsey's Hangar Bar, themed after a character in the Indiana Jones film "Raiders of the Lost Ark," is now open at Disney Springs. 
Jock Lindsey's Hangar Bar, themed after a character in the Indiana Jones film "Raiders of the Lost Ark," is now open at Disney Springs. (Matt Mauney /Orlando Sentinel) Caption Jock Lindsey's Hangar Bar Matt Mauney /Orlando Sentinel 
Jock Lindsey's Hangar Bar, themed after a character in the Indiana Jones film "Raiders of the Lost Ark," is now open at Disney Springs. 
Jock Lindsey's Hangar Bar, themed after a character in the Indiana Jones film "Raiders of the Lost Ark," is now open at Disney Springs. (Matt Mauney /Orlando Sentinel) See more galleries 
One element of the renovation included the closing of Pleasure Island, the center segment of Downtown Disney that featured nightclubs. That general will now be called The Landing. Morimoto Asia will operate out of the building that previously housed Mannequins Dance Palace at Pleasure Island. The Boathouse restaurant, which opened this spring, and Jock Lindsey's Hangar Bar, which opened Tuesday, are also in that new district. 
The Disney Springs expansion includes new retail outlets, more restaurants and two parking garages. The project is scheduled to be complete in 2016.
